RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 13, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INCLUDE THE BEAST was hustled along with the pace and raced at even terms two deep on the turn, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on under steady encouragement. GARY DOING BIZ gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and finished well while taking second later yards. AT THE HALF chased the leaders, rounded the turn about the three path and came along to take third late. SAFE REEZAN was hustled along with the pace and contested even terms nearest the rail on the turn, remained a factor through the upper stretch but dropped back a sixteenth away and flattened stride. NANCYSAIDSO chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn, drifted into the lane and passed some rivals. CHEESE LOUISE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. CALL ME JELLY ROLL chased, rounded the turn about the four path and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Nancysaidso
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam

ENTRY.NAME: Safe Reezan
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,even terms rail turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Include the Beast
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,even terms 2d turn,cleared 1/16,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 9700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 13, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 13, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BONNIE BLUETOOTH came away awkwardly and exchanged contact with Creedibility then stalked off the rail, closed to the front past the three eighths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. HAD THE NOTION rounded the first turn in the three path, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and had to settle for second best. CHIT CHAT GIRL rounded the first turn in the five path then moved to the inside leaving the turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. MOJO MATTERS raced in the four path on the opening turn, picked up the chase past the half mile pole, ran at the rail on the far turn then flattened stride. UPSY DAISY DO stalked in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path but showed little in the lane. CREEDIBILITY became anxious in the gate then ducked out hitting the stall door while making contact with Bonnie Bluetooth, and never factored. MOONLIGHT MISS took the lead at the rail nearing the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, but dropped back at the five sixteenths and faded readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Bonnie Bluetooth
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward,bumped break,stalked,up past 3/8,rail turn,held well drvg

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 43. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WISHING FOR SPRING chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, was eased out leaving the turn and dug in to get up the final strides. IMINCHARGENOW pressured the pace and took the lead two deep approaching the quarter pole, dueled clear midway on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in the final strides. SHOWTHEMONEYHONEY set a pressured pace inside, was met at the rail approaching the quarter pole, dropped back midway on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. PRETTY CASTLE gave chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail and finished well. SWISS HORIZON chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. BANK CARD gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. A GIRL HAS A NAME was not a factor. BOWMANS LAZY GIRL pressured the early pace but dropped back past the three eighths pole and faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Wishing for Spring
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,up final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Bowmans Lazy Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early pace,dropped back past 3/8,faded rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Showthemoneyhoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met rail near 1/4,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Iminchargenow
ENTRY.OWNER: Ali Andrew and Schottroffe Edward T
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up 2d nearing 1/4,clear mid turn,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SECRET CASTLE stalked off the rail on the opening turn, closed to the front approaching the three eighths pole and drew briefly clear toward the quarter, contested the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to edge out the challenge of JAMESTOWN ROAD through the lane. The latter stalked inside on the first turn, took aim approaching the quarter pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn and stayed on through the lane. MISS WAVE moved to the inside and raced with the early pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths and raced evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. MISS LAUREN steadied lightly at the start and raced well off the early pace, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, improved off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. GRACE ELIZABETH bobbled at the break and settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase past the half mile pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths then flattened in the lane. CASTLE OF CAYLEE broke a step slow, raced well off the pace and showed little response through the backstretch. LADY MADISON ducked out leaving the gate then saved ground, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the four path of the far turn. CRUZ IN THE CASTLE raced with the pace two deep, was met toward the three eighths pole and weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Lauren
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied start,well off pace,chased 3/8,off rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,chased 3/8,3& 4p far turn,evenly,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Jamestown Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,aim nearing 1/4,close turn,stayed on lane

ENTRY.NAME: Cruz in the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early pace,met near 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Grace Elizabeth
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled break,off rail,chased past 1/2,4& 5p far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,up near 3/8,briefly clear 1/4,determined lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Law Legacy Stable, LLC. & Ronney Brown

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winner s Of A Race Since March 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUIET IMAGINATION settled off the rail on the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths then dueled through the stretch to get up later yards. MY FLICKER rated close inside on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, took the nod while drifting leaving the far turn, but was met and relented in later yards. SOMEDAY IS TODAY stalked two deep, challenged approaching the half mile pole and took the lead nearing the seven sixteenths, drew clear toward the three eighths, kept the edge at the rail on the far turn but was met leaving the turn and flattened the final sixteenth. MANAROLA rounded the opening turn in the two and three paths, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths, rounded the far turn in the five path and weakened in the lane. TIMEISGOLDEN saved ground and showed little response through the backstretch. REIGN ON AND ON took the lead at the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure nearing the half mile pole but was met approaching the seven sixteenths, dropped back at the three eighths and faded at the rail.

ENTRY.NAME: My Flicker
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John and Longball Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Quiet Imagination
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,3& 4p far turn,dueled,up later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FULL AHEAD took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved inward to show the way, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. ANGELUS DIAMOND rounded the first turn about the three path, bid nearing the seven sixteenths but steadied off the inside of the riderless Sloe Gin Biz in the vicinity of the three eighths pole, recovered stride toward the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and finished evenly to close the gap. TRIPLE AMERICANO settled off the rail on the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths then flattened the final sixteenth. BET ON BITZ showed little response through the backstretch. MEGALODON'SREVENGE rated close to the early pace inside then faded past the three eighths pole. LOOKA LOOKA raced off the rail on the opening turn and showed little response. SLOE GIN BIZ stumbled badly and lost his rider at the break. The three quarter time and final time were adjusted to compensate for the loose horse breaking those two beams.

ENTRY.NAME: Triple Americano
ENTRY.OWNER: Pleasant Fields at Harmony Hill LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Full Ahead
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,rail far turn,steady handling

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8 ,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOIRAINE moved to the front and rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the quarter pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was steadily handled through the stretch. BEST VIRGINIA became a bit anxious in the gate then stalked off the rail, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. MY SISTER PAM saved ground off the pace on the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and finished evenly to take third late yards. SARAH'S WARRIOR settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened mid-stretch. HOW IS SHE rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and passed some rivals in the lane. HERETODAYGONMANANA rounded the first turn about the three path, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the three and four paths of the far turn and weakened in the lane. EX RATED saved ground. WOODSONG'S CASTLE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then weakened. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Best Virginia
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Conrad Randall R
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious gate,stalked off rail,bid 7/16,off rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Moiraine
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail far turn,steady handling

ENTRY.NAME: My Sister Pam
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,even finish,up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Sarah's Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Ma rch 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 13 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THEWITCHISGONE stalked off the rail on the opening turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and took the lead three wide midway on the far turn, drew clear into the stretch and was steadily handled to the wire. THUNDERINREADYRICK broke a step slow then stalked three wide on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and took a brief lead two deep toward the quarter, was met midway on the turn, angled outside the winner past the eighth pole and ran evenly in the lane. GET OFF MY CLOUD settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. REY O REYES took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met at the rail nearing the quarter and weakened leaving the far turn. LEG UP saved ground, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. ROCK FILE saved ground. HARPERSGONEFISHING became fractious in the gate, raced three wide on the opening turn and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Leg Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Get Off My Cloud
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Rey O Reyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,met rail near 1/4,weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Harpersgonefishing
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DE'S CASTLE raced with the pace and took the nod midway on the turn, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on well. MONKEY WRENCH gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path, dug in for second mid-stretch and finished well. UNCLE PRESS bobbled slightly at the break then gave chase toward mid track, rounded the turn about the five path, left the turn outside and finished well to take third late yards. BOO TOO contested the pace, was met midway on the turn and flattened toward mid-stretch. SMALL PAW steadied at the start then gave chase, but flattened in the five path of the turn. J. WICK gave chase, raced in the four path of the turn and showed little in the lane. BAND TOUR gave chase and rounded the turn about the four path. LASTWALKTOFREEDOM was shuffled back on the chute and saved ground. RIVER ROYALE R V F gave chase inside but dropped back at the rail midway on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: River Royale R V F
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,dropped back rail mid turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: J. Wick
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
